text: Childhood skate spot's now just banks and bland buildings. Bummer!
Been turning hikes into geology expeditions lately - dual love for rocks & free entertainment. Also helps dodge those hefty gym fees!
Catching public transit more often now; saves cash and meets new faces!
Ditched pricier outings; stargazing & rock hunting are now go-tos!
Old town’s calm corners are pure gold.
Summer's tough, but seaside geological formations are year-round cool hideouts!
Totally get you! Found these little natural springs dotting around town; it’s like stumbling upon mini oases where you least expect them - pure magic in an asphalt jungle!
Rainy field days—strictly mud-caked boots over reports!
Rain means data collection gets canned - hello unexpected Netflix marathon! Sunny days though? That's prime rock-hunting time outside the house!
Got me chasing sunrises instead!
Adulting slapped me hard when signing off divorce papers - mixing office rigmarole didn’t even come close. Sometimes personal quakes redefine your whole scale of 'grown-up'.
Splitting bills post-divorce felt pretty "grown-up".
Fancy dream jobs? Thought so as a kid, but these days find gnarly satisfaction uncovering earth’s secrets more than any paycheck size could offer - real treasure's beneath our feet!
Childhood dreamt big; real joy's finding balance amidst rocks!
Dream jobs don't always pay dream salaries!

Lifestyle-wise? Think rocks set you free—outdoorsy work means lotsa fresh air & random finds! Sure beats being deskbound—even if paychecks could use some beefing up lol! Adventure calls daily when your office view keeps changing; though gotta admit sometimes yearn for that stability at home base.
Diversifying your income's crucial too – besides the main gig. Always looking out for side projects; they tend to buffer against those leaner months!
Freelancing side gigs can bridge gaps!

Life definitely throws curveballs faster than we imagine - guess it's not just fault lines we gotta keep an eye on! Saving more becomes less 'meh' and more 'must-do', especially when solo adventures turn into family plans... amirite?
Monthly bills are definitely feeling that pinch!

Rocks seemed cool back at uni; now they pay the bills but definitely catch myself pondering alternate universes where hobbies turned careers weren't just daydreams during core samples analysis sessions!
Rocks sync well with career ambitions - but daydreams do surface.
Happy in geology here; sometimes crave more field trips though!
Totally get it! Desk rocks too often... gotta keep life spicy!
Honestly never saw myself dissecting earth samples all day, but now? Can say rocks grew on me. Desk job turned field adventures - life's quirky like that!
"Norms don't dictate drive or skill."
Fields like mine get overlooked when talking gender norms since they don't fit neatly into any box – got into rocks more out of curiosity than anything else society expected me to do!
Geology wasn't exactly on everyone's 'typical male job' list but rocks fascinated me more than stereotypes. Just dug into it – pun intended – & never looked back!
Society hinted oil fields or nothing back home; geology was calling though!
Even rocks are breaking stereotypes these days!

Growing up close inland always had rocks around me; discovered joy picking them apart rather than fitting molds. That love led straight into geology—shows hobbies can spark future paths regardless of old-school "shoulds".
Single life just meant rewatching same old TV series 'cause guess who's hoarding free-time? Hint - definitely not bouncing around different hobbies lol
Since hitting reset personally, gotta admit screens see more of me now – less date nights equals more meme fights!
"Personal space matters; don't let relationships consume individuality."
Post-divorce rediscovery - more crafts less clashes.
Free time's all geological walks & less movie-marathon weekends now.
Lived that myth - turned out true for me, sadly.
Well can't speak for everyone but had my share of waves around then - some stuff just doesn't stick no matter how you try!
Novelty fades; compatibility’s the real deal-breaker.
Not everyone's story fits a timeline!
Flexibility perks post-divorce are real; reshaped priorities here!
Now prioritizing fascinating projects over promotions!
"It ain't math — there's no formula."
Individual change reshapes 'the one's' meaning beyond just compatibility.

Origin stories sure grab hold of folks differently! For me, it's childhood tales tinged with earthy undertones y'know? Digging deep takes a literal spin when rock formations spark narratives rather than seascapes or city skylines ever could!
Hometown vibes run deep; geological wonders spark endless stories here!
No seaside nostalgia here, rocks over water any day!

Gonna have to side with OpalescentOwl here - grew up far from any iconic natural features but doubt rocks programmed me into loving geology lol. It ain't all black and white; we're more than just our surroundings!
Def feel an ancient vibe from old mountains nearby where I come from—not oceans but earthy feels hit different when you're back home walking those familiar streets n’ hillsides!
Birthplace surrounded by mountains; definitely affects outdoor preferences & career path!
Not all grit comes from home turf.

Interesting takes all round but gotta say it's more your journey than where you start off that shapes you – overcame some personal upheavals despite not growing up around much 'hustle' or harsh climates per se; made me who I am today.
Can't relate much, if at all. Where you're from sometimes feels irrelevant—more about where you’re headed or who you want to become than old haunts and echoes from childhood streets.
